oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Capt. J. H. Polk's handwritten songbook kept while prisoner of war
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: While a prisoner of war in the Nashville, Tennessee Penitentiary, Capt. James H. Polk, Co. E, 6th (1st) Tenn. (Wheeler's) Cav., CSA copied songs in the back of an address book. Among the songs were "Triple Barred Banner" and "The Guerilla's Serenade."Captured in Hickman County, Tenn. on Jan. 3, 1864, Polk was imprisoned in Nashville, then sent via Louisville, Ky. to Ft. Delaware and later to Hilton Head, SC. Upon his parole, he requested a transfer to serve on the staff of Brig. Gen. Frank Armstrong.
